Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Number/Equal

Syntax Exp1 == Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 == Exp2
int int bool
int real bool
real real bool
Description Yields true if the value of both arguments is numerically equal, and false otherwise.
Examples 
rascal>12 == 12
bool: true
rascal>12 == 12.0
bool: true
rascal>12 == 13
bool: false
rascal>12 == 13.0
bool: false
rascal>3.14 == 3.14
bool: true
rascal>3.14 == 3
bool: false
Questions
Question 1.
The type of -13 == 3 is

Question 2.
The type of 4.77676141318186800 == -9.750074071133046000 is

Question 3.
The type of 5 == 8.22044133653646800 is

Question 4.
The type of -14 == 7 is

Question 5. 
-11.233880618047527200 == 8 ==
